dc:title: On Pilgrimage - June 1976
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Reminds herself that "the work of the spirit" is as important as other involvements. Visits her daughter Tamar's place in Vermont and admires the handicrafts being taught and practiced, especially working with wool.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 570 1976-06-01 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
